item.description:
Every 2nd and 4th Friday evening is Dinner With Dharma at the Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center at 950 Massachusetts Avenue, between Central and Harvard Squares, Cambridge.

6:30 p.m. Meditation (Sitting and Breathing, led by a Buddhist nun or a leader in training) 
7:00 p.m. Dinner (vegan- but ALWAYS ask because it reminds them) 
7:45 p.m. Dharma Talk and Discussion (scheduled to finish around 9:00 pm)

Cost (Include vegan buffet dinner) 
Adult: $10 Student: $5 (student ID required for the $5 half price)

Special presentation by a Buddhist  nun of the Theravada tradition, Ayya Gotami (Dr. Rev. Prem Suksawat) whose talk is  entitled Live a Simple Life As a Buddhist.

Ayya's presentation will begin with a practical definition of Buddhism and will focus on the basic principles and practices a lay Buddhist follows as a part of living simply.  She will include cultivating happiness, peace, and harmony with "self and others" as well as developing self-discipline, self-confidence, and self-esteem.

Ayyā Gotamī (Dr. Rev. Prem Suksawat) is the abbess of Dhamma Cetiya Buddhist Vihara in West Roxbury.  She founded this temple in 1997.  Before becoming a nun, she worked in the mental health field with public and private agencies.  As a nun, she uses this background to integrate Western psychology and psychiatric treatment with Buddhist teachings to educate and help her students.

We look forward to your joining us this Friday night.  We begin our program at 6:30 with meditation followed by dinner at 7 and the presentation around 7:45.  

PLEASE TAKE CASH ONLY. THEY are unable to accept Credit Cards!!!

Take the T to Central Square, http://www.mbta.com
Walk in TOWARDS Harvard Square until you see 950 Mass Ave on the left (south) side of the street.

Please invite friends and family. If you have any questions, please call the GBBCC.

Omitofo for the event at GBBCC 
Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center 
950 Massachusetts Avenue (#1 bus, between Red Line stops at Central Square and Harvard Square) 
Cambridge, MA 
617-547-6670
item.how_to_find_us: Ask anyone at GBBCC who seems to be 'in the know'
item.why: The buffet and the socialization are awesome, and the price is right.
